text: Olivier Sanou (born July 2, 1975) is a retired Burkinan track and field athlete. He was a high jumper before specializing in the triple jump in the late 1990s. A double African champion, Sanou made his mark in Africa. He competed at the 2004 Summer Olympics, but failed to qualify for the final. ==Competition record== {| |- !colspan="6"|Representing |- |1994 |African Junior Championships |Algiers, Algeria |5th |High jump |2.00 m |- |rowspan=2|1996 |African Championships |Yaoundé, Cameroon |bgcolor="CC9966" | 3rd |High jump |2.13 m |- |Olympic Games |Atlanta, United States | – |High jump |NM |- |1997 |Jeux de la Francophonie |Antananarivo, Madagascar |bgcolor="CC9966" | 3rd |High jump |2.15 m |- |1999 |All-Africa Games |Johannesburg, South Africa |5th |Triple jump |15.74 m |- |2000 |African Championships |Algiers, Algeria |bgcolor="CC9966" | 3rd |Triple jump |16.31 m |- |2001 |Jeux de la Francophonie |Ottawa, Canada |4th |Triple jump |15.84 m |- |rowspan=2|2002 |Africa Military Games |Nairobi, Kenya |bgcolor=gold|1st |Triple jumpAfrica Military Games.
